items.question: How much does it cost to bring you on board for frontend?
items.answer: Pricing depends on volume and criticality of tasks. I can work hourly for targeted fixes, fixed-price for specific features, or full-time slot for several months. After a short call, I provide a range and document it in Notion so the budget is transparent before work begins

items.question: Can we start with a small feature?
items.answer: Yes. We often start with a pilot ticket: refine a component, fix performance, or build a landing page. You see how I integrate into processes, then we can expand the scope

items.question: How quickly can you get started?
items.answer: Usually within 1–3 days: we sync on the task, I connect to the repo and CI, set up the environment. By the first week you already have a ready PR or release build

items.question: Do you work alone or with a team?
items.answer: I handle frontend independently, but if needed, I bring in trusted backend, design, or DevOps people. Communication always goes through me — no managers and no 'lost' requirements

items.question: How are you different from an agency or hiring a full-time developer?
items.answer: Agencies need time to understand, and a full-time developer needs onboarding and retention. With me, you get a senior frontend engineer who already understands processes and doesn't need hand-holding: I quickly take responsibility and deliver measurable results

items.question: What guarantees do you provide?
items.answer: I'm responsible not for 'beautiful code', but for metrics: load speed, errors in Sentry, conversion. After release, I support, refine, and measure results through analytics dashboards

items.question: Where are you located and how do you work with international teams?
items.answer: I'm based in Bali, but I'm used to working with CIS, USA, Europe. Time slots for your timezone, fluent English, I can invoice in any currency or crypto

items.question: Do you work with startups or large companies?
items.answer: Experience with both. In startups, I build frontend platforms from scratch, choose stack and infrastructure. In corporations, I optimize existing applications, close technical debt, and speed up releases
